column3: This version of a cold bean salad is made with canned green beans, garlic, ginger, and curry powder.
I guarantee you will love this meal. It is by far my favorite Indian recipe--my mom still makes this for me to this day. Serve over rice.
Roti Canai, an Indian pancake, are easy to make at home using 6 simple ingredients; eat as a snack or with a meal with curry and sambal.
Black chickpeas are simmered with potatoes, onion, turmeric, and cumin in this classic vegetarian Indian dish called black chana with potatoes.
This Indian salad called kachumbar is a mix of cucumber, tomato, lemon juice, and fresh herbs that'll lighten up any curry it's served with.
These Indian-inspired red lentils (masoor dal) flavored with cumin, turmeric, and ginger can be customized to suit your family's tastes.
Fresh grated coconut and yogurt form the base of this tangy chutney from South India.
This tangy fish curry is an authentic coastal Indian dish that is ready in less than an hour.

This lamb curry features green and red chiles, dried coconut, and almonds in a saffron-yogurt sauce. It's an example of the rich cooking style of Kashmir, worthy of the Moghul emperors--or your dinner guests! Serve it with basmati rice or crusty breads.
This is an easy recipe for Chicken Tikka Masala--chicken marinated in yogurt and spices and then served in a tomato cream sauce. Serve with rice or warm flatbreads.
This recipe makes the best naan I have tasted outside of an Indian restaurant. I can't make enough of it for my family. I serve it with shish kabobs, but I think they would eat it plain.
This recipe combines chicken breast, curry powder, rice, chopped apple, and cream for lovely, Indian-inspired soup.  You will need about an hour to prepare this soup.
This is an easy vegetarian curry. It's rich, creamy, mildly spiced, and extremely flavorful. Serve with naan and rice.

column2: Curry Stand Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce
column3: Chunks of chicken simmer in a spicy tomato and cream sauce for the bright orange chicken tikka masala you crave.
Indian-inspired chicken curry includes a variety of aromatic spices simmered in a coconut milk-based sauce and served with naan bread and rice.
Chicken Makhani is one of my favorite Indian dishes. It is a full flavored dish that complements the chicken well. It can be made as mild or spicy as you wish by adjusting the cayenne.

This is a rich and hearty lentil curry, great as a main meal rather than as a side dish like the more traditional Indian dhal. Don't let the ingredient list faze you, this really is an easy dish to make. This dish is great served with basmati rice.
This creamy curry Indian butter chicken recipe combines ethnic spices with simple ingredients like onion, butter, and tomato sauce for a tasty dish.
Abundant spices make this better than any restaurant curry I've tasted.
Chicken breasts simmer in a curry sauce with yogurt, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and ginger in this spicy Indian dish.
Fragrant basmati rice sauteed with carrots, onions, fresh ginger, peanuts, and cilantro.
Chickpeas are simmered in a fragrantly spiced curry sauce mixture and garnished with fresh cilantro.
Chicken thigh meat cooks with tandoori masala and garam masala in a sauce of coconut milk and tomato in this tasty Indian classic.
Enjoy this spicy Indian eggplant curry dish over rice or with Indian bread (or both).
Spicy potatoes, tomatoes and onions with an Indian kick! This is super spicy so be aware!
Chicken is marinated overnight in a spicy yogurt marinade then grilled in this authentic recipe for Tandoori chicken.
These grilled chicken thighs are moist, luscious, and delicious: they're marinated in yogurt with just the right blend of spices.

This is a savory Indian style rice dish flavored with whole spices and fried onions. Soaking the basmati rice before cooking makes all the difference. Serve with your favorite Indian curry or dal (lentils). Make sure you warn people not to bite into the whole spices!
In this mild Northern Indian dish, chicken is simmered in a creamy fragrant sauce with onion, garlic, ginger and cashews. Serve over basmati or sticky rice.
Ginger, garlic, cumin, cinnamon, turmeric and a host of exotic spices coat sauteed chicken in tomato sauce.  A long simmer seals in the complex flavors of this aromatic dish.
This creamy, smooth mango lassi is made with yogurt and mango and is absolutely heavenly.
This Indian dish combines fresh spinach and ricotta in a creamy curry. Use paneer if you can find it! It is absolutely wonderful with basmati rice or naan.

Cook plain lentils with Indian spices such as turmeric and garam masala and you get this delicious, authentic dahl.  This recipe uses spinach and coconut milk, which is optional.  Perfect addition to rice and curry.
It requires a few ingredients and a little time, but Chef John's recipe for chicken tikka masala is well worth the effort.

Beef and potatoes are the main ingredients folded inside these wonderful deep fried samosas. Chicken livers may be substituted for beef, if you choose. My friend from Bangladesh gave me this savory, spicy recipe. You just can't buy better in the shops.

Chunks of chicken breast cook slowly in a creamy, curry-flavored sauce with coconut milk, peas, and mushrooms for a nicely spicy take on a slow cooker chicken dish. Serve over rice or with hot naan bread.

This recipe brings the authentic flavor of India into your kitchen. It's a delicious combination of red lentils (masoor daal), ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper, onion and cumin. Serve over plain or spiced rice.

column2: Spicy Indian Chicken and Mango Curry
column3: This delicious, Indian-inspired dish is made by quickly cooking chicken and shallots with curry paste, then bathing everything with a coconut milk-mango puree!
This is a traditional North Indian (Punjabi) Bhurtha made with eggplant and tomato, and seasoned with cumin, turmeric garlic and ginger. Serve with fresh roti or naan.
My friend's father, who is from India, showed me how to make this. It's delicious! Serve with hot cooked rice.
This is a subtle and richly-flavored curry that complements the shrimp perfectly--and it's a quick and easy meal! Serve with hot cooked rice.

column2: Gobi Aloo (Indian Style Cauliflower with Potatoes)
column3: Cauliflower, potatoes, and an enticingly fragrant blend of spices make up this traditional Indian dish.
Peas, carrots, and tofu are simmered together in coconut milk with spices, creating a warm, savory Indian favorite. Serve over hot rice, with yogurt on the side.
A simple but delicious recipe for Indian flatbread. Serve with Indian curry, main dishes, or even use to make sandwich wraps. Enjoy!
This popular Indian dish stars spiced chicken in a rich tomato and curry-based cream sauce.

Here's a variation of Aloo Gobi, a traditionally dry Indian dish consisting of potatoes and cauliflower. This recipe calls for coconut milk, tomatoes and chickpeas for a savory main dish in a spicy sauce. Serve with basmati rice or, better, with breads such as roti, naan, or pita.
This is a very flavorful Basmati rice pudding made with coconut milk, raisins, cardamom, and toasted almonds and pistachios. It's the best rice pudding I've ever had, and very easy to make!
Spicy baked white fish fillets are dressed up with a ginger, garlic, onion, and cashew puree in this Bengali recipe.
This recipe produces a quick version of Garam Masala, the aromatic blend of spices often used in Indian cooking.
This is an exotic yet easy to make chicken curry stew. The coconut milk brings a Thai influence to this quick microwave main dish.
My Indian friend taught me how to make this easy traditional Indian okra recipe using fresh okra and spices in a skillet.
This fragrant, spicy Indian butter chicken recipe is from the owner of the India Cuisine restaurant in Seattle, Washington. Serve with hot Indian bread.
This rendition of Indian naan bread calls for yogurt and kalonji, an exotic spice you may have to search for in specialty shops.

White rice is sauteed in butter and then simmered with saffron infused water.  The secret of obtaining fluffy rice is in having the rice hot enough that when the boiling water is added it does not stop boiling.

For a traditional Pakistani/Indian dish, simmer tender morsels of chicken in a creamy, spicy blend of onion, garlic, ginger, turmeric, cumin, tomatoes, yogurt, mint, cardamom and cinnamon. Finish by steaming with fragrant saffron rice and potatoes.
Onions, fresh ginger, jalapenos and garlic fried in oil with mustard seeds are added to cooked red lentils in this soup seasoned with ground coriander, cumin and cilantro.

column2: Tim Perry's Soup (Creamy Curry Cauliflower and Broccoli Soup)
column3: A simple curry soup that will not disappoint neither with its flavor, nor with its simplicity of preparation.  Broccoli and cauliflower serve as the main components of this one-pot wonder. Serve with crusty bread and butter.
This is an Indian vegetarian curry with nuts, paneer cheese, and an adjustable list of vegetables. It is in a tomato-cream sauce as opposed to the usual yogurt-based sauce.
Potatoes and peas are cooked in a tomato sauce with Indian seasonings.

column2: Curried Chicken and Brown Rice Casserole
column3: Cinnamon, garlic, raisins, lemon juice, and tomatoes enliven this quick and easy curried chicken casserole.
Cucumber and mint make an amazingly refreshing salad when stirred together with Greek yogurt and lemon juice.

Ground lamb is sauteed with onions and lots of masala, and served over rice or noodles for a quick, flavorful meal. This recipe may be modified by adding peas (mattar), potatoes, or any other vegetable you like. It can also be used as a samosa or pastry filling.
Ground lamb is seasoned with fresh mint and cilantro, and ginger and green chili paste, and made into delicious shish kabobs. Serve with lime wedges, mint chutney, and sliced, sweet Vidalia onions.

A paste made from a combination of spices and dried peppers is the secret to this spicy grilled chicken recipe. No long marinating time is required; the chicken can be prepared in the time it takes to get the coals hot.
Cardamom flavored frozen dessert made with condensed and evaporated milk, white bread and whipped topping.
Coconut milk, curry, and mango chutney really put a new set of flavors in this spin on turkey chili.
I guarantee you will love this meal. It is by far my favorite Indian recipe--my mom still makes this for me to this day. Serve over rice.
Spread cream cheese on your favorite crackers and top with this zesty relish. Red bell peppers and sweet onion are simmered in white wine vinegar and red pepper flakes.

column2: Indian-Style Rice with Cashews, Raisins and Turmeric
column3: Basmati rice is simmered with coconut milk, spices, raisins, and cashews to make a colorful, fragrant Indian-style rice.

This is a home-style South Indian shrimp curry recipe from my husband's family. It is simple and quick to make. It contains no coconut so is not sweet, just mostly juicy and as hot as you like it. Serve with basmati rice or an Indian flatbread.
This is a great creamy curry recipe. It is very mild, and unlike typical curries. A crowd pleaser!
Making a paste of onion, tomato, chile pepper, ginger, and garlic starts you on your way to a relatively simple homemade Indian dish.
This is the easiest korma recipe I have! A winner for us. Not too spicy, but lots of flavor. If you have ever wanted to try Indian food, this is a good one to start with. Serve over hot rice.
Made with chicken tenders, apricot preserves, garam masala, and lime zest, this spicy sweet chicken has flavors inspired by South Asian cuisine.
This tomato based curry may be modified for hotness depending on quantity of spices and number of jalapeno peppers used. It is a great favourite with my family - I make it about once a month.
This delicious, simple coconut rice adds an exotic touch to any meal!  Especially great with fish such as salmon.
Mango chutney is simmered with the chicken and curry paste in this tasty dish.

Chickpeas (garbanzo beans), turnips, and corn combine in this warming meal.  It's a meaty dish, with a hint of curry and cumin flavor.  Serve on it's own or on some basmati rice. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!
Pakoras are a favorite in India. Your favorite vegetables are dipped in a spicy batter and deep fried to make fabulous fritters.

This simple version of the classic Indian chicken dish uses plain yogurt, tomato sauce, ginger, garlic, Indian chili powder, garam masala, dried fenugreek leaves, and, of course, butter, for a tasty main dish served over rice.
This is a delicious and savory curried barley dish.  It is fabulous as a main dish, or as a side dish with fish or grilled chicken breast. It is quite simple to make and sure to impress!
A few splashes of your favorite chai (spiced Indian tea) add a complex spiciness to this banana bread. And non-fat cream cheese adds rich flavor without the guilt.

column2: Indian Stir-Fried Shrimp in Cream Sauce (Bhagari Jhinga)
column3: Shrimp is cooked in a flavorful sauce made with coconut milk, cumin, garam masala, cilantro and lemon juice. This dish is not too spicy, and is very easy to make.
This simple dish of curried chicken and onion proves that even the most basic curry can still pack a punch.
A flavorful side dish of Indian cuisine.  This dish blends the mild flavor of cumin with the unrelenting spice of  curry.  A truly engaging dish.
A vegetarian version of keema, this curry is made with minced firm tofu with green peas.
A curried yellow split pea soup flavored with ginger, chili pepper, tomatoes, cumin and garlic. Serve hot in soup bowls, or over rice.

Masala means a spicy mixture. Vegetable masala is a mixture of vegetables like potatoes, carrots, peas and beans cooked with onions & tomatoes adding spices like garam masala powder, ginger and garlic powder.

This not only tastes glorious, but it looks glorious as well. The cauliflower is brushed with oil and turmeric before being baked whole in the oven. A curry sauce is whipped up and poured over the golden cauliflower when it emerges from the oven.

A more traditional version of the Anglo-Indian invention, this Mulligatawny combines tamarind concentrate, lemon juice, coconut milk, red lentils, and fresh cilantro with lots of vegetables and exotic spices.  A delicious and warming soup.

column2: Delightful Indian Coconut Vegetarian Curry in the Slow Cooker
column3: This delightful vegetarian curry dish from the slow cooker is made creamy with the use of coconut cream and given heat from the curry powder, chili powder, red pepper flakes, and cayenne pepper.
This is quick and delicious! Eat the cauliflower with plenty of naan or rice; it's especially delicious with a side of plain yogurt!
Chicken breast simmered with sherry, beef bouillon, peanut butter and curry powder. Other spices and the addition of coconut milk all add up to an unusual, creamy curry chicken.
This chicken curry recipe is totally diner style. The chicken thighs make it very soft and melt in your mouth! It's so easy to make too. Serve with rice, puri, naan or chappathi.
Indian saag is a curry of cooked mustard greens and spinach, tasty with naan bread.
Saffron-scented rice cooked with butter and onion makes a wonderful side dish for any special occasion.
Frozen vegetables make this exotically spiced seafood dish a breeze to make!
This curry really is delicious! Cubed yam and fresh pear are the unusual ingredients in this vegetarian chickpea curry!

column2: Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Tikka Masala
column3: Your favorite Indian dish has never been so easy, thanks to this recipe for slow cooker chicken tikka masala.

This is a very flavourful recipe from North India, usually eaten with fried bread like bhatura or puri. I like to serve it over rice for a very filling meal. You can also try it as a quick snack over toasted bread. This recipe is much quicker to make if you use precooked canned beans, but I like to think that the authentic flavour comes from doing it the hard way!

This is an easy, authentic dish from South Asia that appeals to a wide range of tastes. The combination of ingredients may appear unusual, but even those shy to experiment with new flavors love this one. Vegan-friendly!
Lamb is simmered in a spicy tomato curry enriched with cream. This is a very mouthwatering dish that is easy to make. Serve with hot cooked rice or your favorite bread.
Saag paneer is a classic Indian dish of cooked spinach studded with cubed of fried paneer cheese. Thickened with cream or coconut milk, it's a hearty and filling vegetarian meal.

This tastes exactly like the dish that I always get at my favorite Indian restaurant.  I made it up one day and everyone was shocked.  It has quite the mix of ingredients, but they all play a key role in getting the taste and consistency that I was looking for.
A spicy green bean side dish!
Easy paneer recipe.  Add to your favorite curry or dish.  Great for vegetarians.  Home made paneer is softer and lighter than the tofu consistency paneer you find in many Indian restaurants.
This is an easy vegetarian tofu vindaloo similar to the kind found in Indian restaurants.
Chicken parts are brushed with a butter and curry mixture and baked in a mixture of rice, seasonings and dried fruit.
It's important to use good mayonnaise in this recipe, and to let the cooked potatoes chill overnight before making the salad.  Vary the seasoning amounts to suit your taste.
Boneless pork loin slowly cooks in a curried fruit sauce until tender and delicious.
Chopped tomatoes and cucumbers are tossed with a sour cream, yogurt, garlic and cumin dressing. A sprinkling of paprika and it 's ready to serve.
This recipe resembles a dish from an Indian restaurant in my town. I love it. It's got a great unique flavor to it; garam masala is the spice used. Creamy - a favorite! Serve over rice.
Potatoes, peas and carrots are cooked with Indian spices for an easy yet exotic side dish.
A yogurt-based marinade with cayenne pepper, ginger and garlic spice up your salmon fillets before they go under the broiler.
An Indian friend of mine showed me the ropes for cooking this delicious and completely authentic Indian dish of spinach and paneer.
A crisp and sweet flatbread that's fried on the griddle.
There is no leavening in this simple, tender Indian flatbread of bread flour, oil, salt and water.  Once shaped, it bakes on an inverted skillet on the stove in a matter of seconds.
Basmati rice enhanced with the flavors of jeera (cumin), garam masala, mixed vegetables and onions.
Thy this delicious and authentic recipe for chicken and potato curry with cayenne pepper to make it spicy.
This fish curry recipe works well with catfish, tilapia, or orange roughy. As with all Indian dishes, feel free to adjust the spices to your tastes.
This fantastic Indian vegetarian curry recipe is great with Indian-style breads or rice.
Garbanzo beans, onions, and spices are simmered together in this typical Northern Indian recipe that is easy to make, and delicious.  You will need to go to an Indian grocery to buy the masalas.

column2: Pumpkin Curry with Lentils and Apples
column3: East meets West in this inspired curry dish combining fresh pumpkin with lentils, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, fresh spinach, and apples designed to delight vegetarians.

Always a favorite, this version of the classic chicken curry from North India is made fragrant and flavorful with a tantalizing sauce of spices, garlic, tomatoes, ground almonds, heavy cream and yogurt.
This version of the delicate Indian flatbread uses durum wheat flour - the kind often used to make pasta - for its durability.
A yeast-raised South Asian flatbread with a delicious chewy texture.
A great blend of exciting and subtle flavors are infused into a whole chicken during cooking.
This creamy cauliflower soup gets a double shot of robust flavor from roasting the cauliflower and a mixture of curry powder, cayenne pepper, and turmeric.
Spicy roasted chickpeas are crisp, spicy little nibbles. This is one snack that you can feel good about munching.
The classic Indian chicken and spinach dish gets richness from sour cream.
Pressed tofu cubes are baked with a yogurt and spice sauce, then simmered with cauliflower and peas in a creamy red sauce.
This is a crunchy chicken and rice salad with an East Indian influence.

Chicken is simmered in an onion-tomato sauce in this really nice Indian recipe, taught to me by an elderly Indian lady, who used to cook for all her family. It is a simple recipe and tastes lovely served with rice.  You can also use mutton instead of chicken.

Great for dinner parties, this colorful and flavorful dish is inspired by southern Indian cooking. Potatoes, cauliflower florets, and red lentils combine with onions, garlic, curry powder, ginger, tomatoes, malt vinegar, and chutney.
This chutney closely resembles imported Indian chutneys and is good with all curry dishes.  It is also great with cream cheese and crackers.
This flavorful recipe is a winter staple in Kashmir.

Chicken breast meat is rubbed with an intoxicating paste made with cilantro, mint, and other distinctive flavors. Chicken legs may also be used, or a combination of legs and breasts. This recipe is cooked in the oven, but will work well on the grill. Serve hot with onion rings.
This is an easy and authentic-tasting Indian dish that the entire family will love! Tastes great with plain basmati rice topped with a couple tablespoons of yogurt.

column2: Slow Cooker Chicken Curry with Quinoa
column3: Chicken, quinoa, and apples, combine in this tasty, easy curry!
This amazing curry is made by simmering lamb in a homemade curry paste. It takes time, but it's worth it! This is my all-time favorite curry to make; it's pungent flavor wins me over every time.
A rich chickpea and potato curry with coconut milk and Indian spices is surprisingly easy to make.

This lamb curry features green and red chiles, dried coconut, and almonds in a saffron-yogurt sauce. It's an example of the rich cooking style of Kashmir, worthy of the Moghul emperors--or your dinner guests! Serve it with basmati rice or crusty breads.
Hot turmeric milk, or haldi ka doodh, is a delicious and traditional Indian home remedy used to soothe a cold or sore throat.

column2: Aloo Gobi Masala (Cauliflower and Potato Curry)
column3: This is a traditional Indian cauliflower and potato curry recipe.
Quick vegetarian samosas with a curried garbanzo bean filling. You can adjust the amount of curry paste according to your taste.
This is a fresh and delicious cucumber salad tossed with lemon, cumin, cilantro, and peanuts that is very easily prepared in just a few minutes.
This is a tasty and interesting vegetable biryani. The color looks appetizing and the taste is great! It's delicious served with mint chutney or simple, plain yogurt.

column2: Garam Masala Seared Salmon with Coconut-Curry Butter
column3: Salmon fillets are dusted with garam masala, seared for a crispy crust, then served with a coconut-curry beurre blanc.

Grapes and carrots are tossed with cumin and roasted to create this Indian dish I had while visiting a French family in the Luberon Valley. So I guess it's a French-Indian side dish. I love it and make it all the time.
First popular in Punjab, India, and originally sometimes flavored with ground cumin, today's  version of lassi is a sweet, frothy blend of yogurt, milk, and fruit served well chilled.
Beef, spinach, tomatoes, and coconut milk are simmered together with a variety of spices, creating a wonderful curry.
Traditional Indian dish made of spiced cauliflower and potatoes. This dish is steamed and then fried in oil making it intentionally dry and somewhat crispy.
This easy chutney is a great companion for so many dishes from turkey sandwiches to pork chops.
This delightful recipe for cubes of paneer in a tomato-cream sauce is sure to be a nice treat.
Fragrant and rich, this sauce includes spices like coriander, cumin and turmeric with the requisite garlic and ginger, all stirred with a puree of tomatoes, chile peppers and yogurt.

This is a very tasty cilantro-based chutney that can be prepared in minutes. Just add fresh lemon juice, a small green chili, peanuts, salt, garlic, and fresh ginger to the cilantro and process until smooth.
Steamed chicken is blanketed in a garlic-tomato-curry sauce flavored with garam masala, a fusion of Indian spices noted for its warming qualities.  Traditionally eaten with rice or Indian bread.
In this Indian dry curry, potatoes, cauliflower, carrots and peas are fried and flavored with spices, garlic, and chiles. It's perfect as a side dish for an Indian dinner.
You boil lentils, then blend them until smooth to make this pungent puree; curry-scented spices--like cumin, garlic and cayenne--finish the dish.
This is a hearty meal of chicken and potatoes simmered with Indian spices, tomatoes, Swiss Chard, and yogurt.  Adjust the spices to taste.  Serve it over basmati rice.

This delicious vegetarian stew is made in the pressure cooker, using dried kidney beans and a spice paste with garlic, ginger, and onion. Serve over rice or with flatbreads for a flavorful and wallet-friendly dinner.

column2: Sweet and Spicy Curry with Chickpeas
column3: An easy curry of turkey and garbanzo beans simmers with coconut milk and bottled tomato-based sweet chili sauce to make a savory-sweet dish that's ready in less than an hour.
These richly spiced lentils are simmered for two hours in a spicy tomato sauce and finished with splash of cream for a filling side dish.

This is a traditional Indian dessert.  Spongy milky balls soaked in rose scented syrup. Delicious with fresh cream, Kulfi, ice cream etc. To make it even more fancy, sprinkle gold-leaf on top of each serving.
A trademark of home-cooking in southern India, this luscious chicken dish is an authentic Hyderabadi-style biryani.
Everyone's favorite Indian take-out dish comes together in a slow cooker for an easy way to prepare chicken tikka masala.
This is a spicy alternative to classic basil pesto. Add to pasta, fish, or chicken dishes as you would any other pesto sauce.
A fragrant yellow curry powder to use in soups, sauces, rice, and anything else you can think of!
The special curry compound known as garam masala is the key to this vigorous chicken, onion and green chile curry.  Ginger-garlic paste and red chili powder really bring on the fire.

Enjoy this Indian recipe for rajma (red kidney beans) with jeera (cumin) rice. You can spice this up according to your taste! If you have an Indian grocery store in your area, you could add a great taste to it by adding one spoon of 'garam masala' which is a special blend of mixed spices...But it's just as great without it!

These stuffed savory pastries are a traditional Indian favorite. Lamb meat and spices are cooked together to create a mouthwatering filling for the easy to make dough. The recipe may seem complex, but it's actually fairly simple. Enjoy!
Chicken legs simmer in a thick curry sauce for a delicious dinner with just the right amount of spice. Serve over rice, or with a flatbread like chapatti or roti.
Prepare this flavorful Indian curry in less than hour! Serve with rice or naan.
Similar to a wheat pita, it is bread made of whole wheat flour.  I make it for my diabetic husband all the time.  Serve these with your favorite fish or vegetable dish.

column2: Aloo Gobi ki Subzi (Potatoes and Cauliflower)
column3: This is a simple and easy to toss together recipe using cauliflower. Serve this dish with Indian breads such as thin rotis or naans--even a pita bread will do! Garnish with cilantro if you'd like. Asofoetida can be found in some grocery stores, but will most likely be found in an Indian grocery store, it is often called 'hing'.
This traditional, cardamom-flavored Indian sweet may now be made in under 15 minutes!
Sliced okra rounds are seasoned with cumin and curry powder in this quick and easy dry curry recipe.
This is an East Indian sweet tamarind chutney.

column2: Pantry Curried Quinoa with Garbanzo Beans and Roasted Peppers
column3: Pantry staples like canned garbanzo beans, quinoa, roasted red peppers, and dried herbs and spices come together in this great pantry-to-plate dish.
This is a great weeknight dinner entree - quick and easy with only five ingredients and delicious!  Great with couscous or rice.

column2: Indian Hot Curried Mangos with Tofu
column3: Mango slices and tofu cubes are simmered together in curry-seasoned coconut milk.  If you don't like the taste of tofu, chicken or shrimp are easily substituted.
Spicy, creamy, and sweet chai tea is easy to make with the help of your slow cooker.
This mango lassi uses canned mangos to create a smoother, tastier drink.

Ground cumin, chile peppers and ginger are stirred into a hot mixture of tomatoes, crushed pineapple and water. This is when your kitchen begins to smell wonderful. Add a bit of cilantro, lime juice and golden-roasted cumin seeds. Soup for four.
Indian fried rice made with long-grain rice, cumin, black peppercorns, and onions.

column2: Indian Sweet Potato and Lentil Soup
column3: Lentils, sweet potatoes, onions, and spinach are simmered with aromatic Indian-inspired spices, creating a deliciously warm and hearty meal.
Tender morsels of chicken breast are simmered in a fragrant combination of Bengali flavors including turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves.
Simple basmati rice, with its subtle, flowery fragrance, cooks up light and fluffy with cinnamon sticks and a bay leaf to make a perfect side dish for so many meals.
This creamy curry is sweetened up with bits of apple. Serve it over a bed of steamy rice, and you've got dinner ready in under an hour.
Cauliflower and spinach are simmered in a curry-flavored tomato broth for a warm and fragrant dish. Serve with roti breads for a complete meal.
A refreshing Indian salad that is the perfect complement to a curry meal. The peanuts add a wonderful nuttiness to this simple and tasty salad.
Eggplant cubes are browned, then simmered with onions in a sauce fragrant with Indian spices.
Marinate the chicken overnight for a deliciously flavorful and tender chicken dish. This is an adaptation of Tandoori style chicken, minus the red coloring.
This rice is delicious and full of surprises -raisins, lentils, bell peppers, peas and potatoes  - make their appearance. And lots and lots of aromatic spices - cardamom to coriander.

Cumin seeds are fun to cook with, they come alive when you drop them in hot oil, and they impart a very special flavor to this rice. Use your imagination if you 'd like to add other tastes to this already tasty dish. Grated carrots, raisins, ginger or cinnamon would be nice.
This is a variation on the traditional crispy rice cereal treat with an international twist! Cashews, golden raisins and cardamom are thrown into the mix for an exotic Indian flair.

The sweetness of mango, pineapple and red pepper is given a zing from fresh ginger and a kick from hot chile pepper.  Serve this chutney with grilled chicken or seafood for an exciting burst of flavor!
Garam masala and lime give an Indian flavor to this simple roast chicken.
This make-ahead vindaloo recipe is a guaranteed crowd pleaser and will convert many to Indian food.  It can be made with any meat and most pantry items.
Simple, fragrant, Indian-inspired chicken simmers in a light sauce made flavorful with turmeric, cinnamon, garam masala, and fresh spinach.
Tomato lentil soup seasoned with Indian spices is a warm and comforting meal that pairs nicely with a grilled cheese sandwich.

column2: Coconut Curried Tofu with Green Beans and Coconut Rice
column3: This is the no-fuss curry recipe for 'quick and easy' cooks out there. The rice is simple yet sweet and flavorful and the tofu with green beans will satisfy even the pickiest eaters.

Shredded carrots are cooked with sugar, raisins and cashews. This is a healthy dessert recipe that you can make for kids who don't eat carrots. Substitute carrots with beetroots and you get Beetroot halwa.
A simple, flavorful Indian-style dish! Peas and cauliflower are sauteed with cumin and mustard seed.
Basmati rice is lightly fried with cumin, cloves and onion, then simmered with garam masala, chili powder and mixed vegetables.
Saffron threads lend a deep, golden color to this spice infused, Indian rice dish.

A traditional North Indian (Punjabi) curry dish. An aromatic and spicy combination of chicken pieces and potatoes cooked in a tomato based stew. This recipe can be easily adapted to suit individual spice tastes.
This spicy potato and chicken dish can be adapted to use any meat you wish.

This is a very simple, quick and more importantly authentic Indian side dish of grilled eggplant and tomato. Best served with naan or roti. It should have a consistency of, um, well, 'mush' when finished, but it's good.
Garam masala is a spicy blend of aromatic spices and chiles from northern India. Make it at home, and you'll never want to use the store bought blend again.
This is a very popular recipe in India, liked by almost everyone. You may have to go to a nearby Asian Indian store to get the 'Pav Bhaji Masala' that is the special spice to bring the flavor.

First you saute onion with cinnamon and cumin. A very happy beginning. Then you stir in tomatoes, fresh shelled peas and coconut milk perfumed with chili powder, coriander, and turmeric. Simmer until peas are tender.
Apple imparts a sweet complexity to this curried mushroom cream sauce, quickly prepared with the help of the microwave.
A delicious traditional vegetarian Indian dish of chickpeas, onions, and tomatoes you can have ready in under an hour.
These attractive little samosas of curried sweet potatoes make a nice appetizer or cocktail party hors d'oeuvre!

Paneer is an essential ingrediant in Indian cooking. Often people substitue riccotta or some other kind of cheese. But they never taste the same and paneer is so easy to make. With this simple recipe, you'll give true Indian authenticity to all your dishes.
Cabbage is simmered with coconut milk and curry, making a wonderful side dish to serve with fried fish!
Red chiles, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, ginger, and garlic all lend their robust flavors to this popular Indian dish.
Fragrant basmati rice is cooked with peanuts, green peas, and a little turmeric.

column3: Lean pork chops and tender cauliflower florets in a creamy and lightly sweet curry sauce are served over piping hot rice.
Baked samosas made with pie crust and seasoned potatoes and peas are an easy version of the Indian-inspired appetizer without all the oil.
These coconut cupcakes with curry lemon curd and a sweet basil cream topping are regal enough for a queen! They take time to create, but the end result is worth it.
This quick and tasty Indian yogurt side dish is accented with green chile pepper, cilantro, and cucumber.
In this simple recipe, chicken is marinated in yogurt and tandoori masala, then grilled over hot coals to produce the complex flavors of Tandoori chicken.

Rogan Josh is an aromatic lamb dish that originates in Northern India. In this variation, submitted from Australia, lamb shanks and vegetables are slow cooked with cardamom, coriander, and ginger in a creamy and tangy tomato sauce.
Everyone will enjoy these delicious potatoes cooked up with Indian spices.
This easy carrot and coriander soup is lovely and creamy, with a bit of a twang. It's an ideal winter warmer or a spicy starter which delights the palate. Suitable for vegetarians.
Chana masala, an Indian-inspired dish, contains chickpeas and tomatoes simmered in a nicely spiced coconut sauce. Serve with jasmine rice.
This Indian lamb and rice dish is a delicious meal for dinner parties.
Indian-inspired rice is nicely spiced with curry powder, cinnamon, and garlic powder for a delicious and aromatic side dish.
A unique and delicious way to serve corn!
This flavorful, vegetarian curry is made with carrot, yam, red potatoes, tomatoes, and cauliflower.

A hot, sweet, sour and fragrant explosion of taste on a plate. The longer you leave to infuse the tastier it gets! You wont serve a better curry. Serve with rice or naan bread. Don't worry about the other whole spices, as the cooking will soften them. Enjoy as your tongue hits all the different combination of flavors.

A vegetarian tofu salad that's just loaded with flavor! Cubed tofu tossed with rice, grapes, dried cranberries, walnuts, and green onion coated with a curry lime dressing. Serve on a bed of lettuce or in pita pockets.
Vegetarian curry recipe made with chickpeas and Quorn(R), and seasoned with a homemade curry seasonings mixture.
Make a homemade version of a chai tea latte with boiling water, milk, sugar, honey, and a tea bag.
Lamb is seasoned with a homemade curry mixture of coriander, cumin, cardamom, and ginger in this easy and flavorful dish.
This flavorful blend of spices, vegetables, and tofu is great served over basmati rice.
A mild, fragrant mix of lamb, raisins, and apples produces a wonderful, slow cooked curry.

Here is a basic recipe for Indian Lassi (yogurt drink).  You can add more or less yogurt or water for a thicker or thinner beverage. For a salty lassi, you can substitute 1/2 teaspoon salt for the sugar. Garnish with fresh mint if desired.
This simple recipe combines the traditional Indian flavors of eggplant, tomatoes, onions and coriander.  This is excellent served with rice and dahl.

column2: Seared Salmon with Indian-Inspired Cream Sauce
column3: A creamy stovetop sauce accented with curry and saffron and made from chopped fresh Portobello and Porcini mushrooms, onions, fennel, celery, garlic, and chicken stock is a perfect complement for salmon.
This is a delicious Indian lentil soup with spicy red onions!
The deep flavors and piquant aromas of southern Indian cooking come to life in this recipe. Chicken bakes in a yogurt and tomato sauce rich with herbs and spices.
A cooling drink made with mango and yogurt, Eastern Indian Lassi.
This chai tea is hot, spicy, and has a hint of the exotic...gotta love it!
Quinoa replaces basmati rice in this fragrant take on a traditional Indian side dish.
This is a spicy curry dish with okra, tomatoes, and onion.
Tender lamb meat is simmered in an Indian-inspired curry sauce for a delicious and warming meal. Serve with rice.
Chicken thighs and drumsticks simmer in a creamy yogurt sauce flavored with lots of fresh cilantro, ginger, and a hint of heat from serrano chiles.
Canned salmon is pan-fried with onions, tomatoes, and spices to make a quick, Indian-inspired meal.
A delicious traditional English breakfast dish using smoked white fish, rice and eggs. It is based on the Indian dish Khichri and comes from the days of the Raj.

This is a traditional Muglai dish prepared in India. It gets its name from the succulence of the meat after prolonged marinating and light braising. Traditionally, chicken, beef or lamb meat is used, but prawns or scallops are good substitutes too for this smooth as silk kebabs.

Cod fillets are marinated in a blend of yogurt and spices then oven baked. This is a rich Indian delicacy that will definitely win your hearts. Serve with basmati rice biryani (spicy Indian rice) or plain white rice and lemon and lentil soup.
This is a wonderful Indian curry made with paneer cheese and frozen peas.
Exciting Indian spices bring a warm, exotic flavor to fried okra.
Try this version of a classic vegetarian Indian stir-fry dish featuring cauliflower and potatoes.
Black peppercorns, coriander, and cayenne lend a distinct flavor to this South Indian goat curry.
Fresh spinach and kale are cooked with ginger, garlic, and spices, then simmered with milk and cottage cheese to make a creamy dish to serve with hot cooked rice or naan.
If you like the flavor of chickpea flour (besan) in sweets, you will love this halwa. Your kids may gobble it up even before it has a chance to cool down.
An extremely flavorful roast with very aromatic gravy. You can add cubed potatoes and peas as you are finishing the roast in the oven to create an extremely flavorful accompaniment for the meat.
Lamb is marinated in yogurt and garlic overnight, then slowly stewed with curry spices, almonds and currants.
Yogurt and lemon mix with tandoori spice--a blend including cumin, ginger, turmeric and red pepper--for a tart, rich, slightly hot marinade and baking sauce in this traditional Indian dish.

column2: Spicy Indian Chicken with Green Masala
column3: Chicken drumsticks are simmered in a home made green masala packed with fresh cilantro.

column2: Masala Beef with Ginger and Curry Leaf
column3: Cubed beef is simmered in a spicy liquid until nearly dry, then combined with an onion mixture seasoned with curry leaves. It's delicious served with white rice.
Put yourself in a holiday mood with this merry drink blending spiced chai tea with hot chocolate.
Fresh turmeric and fresh ginger give this warm turmeric milk, made with almond milk, a spicy and soothing flavor.
This Indian stuffed naan bread has a wonderful, spicy filling and is surprisingly easy to make.

This is a very tasty brown rice recipe salad made with asparagus, apples, raisins, and a curry lemon dressing. Mmm!! Very different and tasty served with barbeque meats. I don't think this need to be changed at all, it is so perfect the way it is.
Chicken strips are coated in a creamy, spicy yogurt sauce, dipped in bread crumbs, and fried in butter. Set aside some of the yogurt mixture to use as a delicious dipping sauce.
This tangy curried spinach soup gets a spicy kick from serrano chiles and cumin seeds, with a crunch from cashews. Serve hot.
Chicken wings with a light curry flavor will make a nice snack, appetizer, or game-day treat.
This rice side dish recipe utilizes a rice cooker.
Try this warm, thick, and comforting dish with split black lentils to warm yourself on a cold day.
This spicy, creamy, and vegan-friendly okra curry dish is very simple to make and will even please non-vegans.
Pureed mango and mango nectar are blended with lemon yogurt, vanilla yogurt, milk, and honey to make a delicious beverage suitable for serving with your favorite curry dish.
This version of a popular Indian dessert consists of cheese dumplings in a cream sauce topped with pistachios and almonds.

column2: Naan Bread Margherita Pizza with Prosciutto
column3: Substitute naan bread for pizza dough and top with mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, and prosciutto creating a naan bread margherita pizza for a quick and easy dinner.
Lightly fried paneer simmers in a thick tomato sauce spiced with cumin, coriander, red chile powder, and garam masala in this vegetarian Indian dish.
Turnips and turnip greens are cooked with onion and mustard seeds and finished with coconut in this Indian side dish.
Spicy and sweet - ginger, garlic, chili powder, and curry paste are just a few of the flavors in this tomato chutney. Best made with tomatoes fresh from the garden.

This is one of my favorite easy-to-make Indian recipes. Although I try to make it the best as I can, my grandma is THE BEST at this... the smell of which reminds me of my school days! Please watch out for measurements.. may not be wholly American!
A garlic and ginger rub sets the stage for a spicy, homemade cilantro chutney to serve over chicken baked in a divine cashew cream.  Definitely worth the work!
One of the most well-known Indian-Pakistani dishes made. A spicy chicken and rice dish.
Delicious, creamy dressing with just a bit of spice.
Indian-spiced, vegetarian green pea balls are deep fried and served either as a main dish, or as an appetizer.
Make these from-scratch flatbreads without yeast using this quick and easy recipe the next time you are looking for an alternative to naan.

This sauce base for curry is made with onions, tomatoes, turmeric, cumin, garam masala, and curry paste.  I love to throw it in the slow cooker with frozen mixed veggies all day for a healthy Indian dinner.
A great use for leftover Thanksgiving turkey.  Serve with warm naan bread or atop steamed white rice.

A medley of winter vegetables--parsnips, carrots, potatoes, celery, garlic and onions--are tossed with raisins and cashews, and seasoned with curry powder, ginger, turmeric, coriander, and Asian five-spice powder in this hearty beef curry dish inspired by Indian and Pakistani favorites.

I made up this mixture on a whim and wow!  These are definitely the best hamburgers I've ever had and everyone who's had them says the same.  The spices are Indian in origin, but the flavor is deliciously unique!
This is the Malaysian version of Indian chicken curry, which uses coconut milk. It can be substituted with yogurt or low-fat milk, but the taste won't be the same.
Hotly spiced, this golden Indian chicken saute is ready to serve in minutes.
This exotic tea uses cardamom, cinnamon and pepper for flavor.
Swordfish chunks are simmered in a mango and coconut mixture. Serve over rice.

Mild and delicious halibut fillets are rubbed in Indian inspired spices and quickly pan fried.

A richly fragrant sauce made with spices, cream, and tomato is served with Indian paneer cheese and chickpeas for a hearty Indian dish. Serve over rice or with naan.
Cabbage and potatoes are flavored with an array of aromatic Indian spices for a refreshing vegetable side dish.
This recipe is from North India where my mother was born. She gave me the recipe when I was moving out. It has been a favorite dish in my family for years.
Spicy cinnamon chai tea with chocolate is a great warm drink for those cold winter nights!

If you like a less spicy Mulligatawny, this recipe is for you.  You will need to have five cups of White Stock on hand (see White Stock recipe), as well as carrots, celery, green pepper, onion, chicken, chopped apple, and rice.

column2: Indian Matar Paneer (Cottage Cheese and Peas)
column3: Learn how to make your own paneer (Indian cheese) in this recipe for stir fried vegetables flavored with exciting seasonings. You'll be surprised at how easy it can be to enjoy the exotic flavors of India.
Garbanzo beans, mango, romaine lettuce, pineapple, cucumber, celery, and carrots are seasoned with salt and lemon juice to make a simple and refreshing salad.
A bountiful medley of beans and vegetables. This easy curry can be made in minutes. Increase or decrease the spices to suit your taste. Serve over rice with Indian naan bread or chapatti (flatbread).
Lamb is simmered in a coconut milk curry sauce with potatoes and chickpeas in this tasty Kashmiri-style recipe. Serve with jasmine rice and mango chutney.

This chicken dish is served over rice, and explodes with the flavors of India!
Unexpected Indian flavorings take this favorite to an appealing new place. Eat with pita chips, bread, or carrot sticks.
Carrots and bean sprouts are tossed with fresh coconut, cilantro, and a simple dressing made with lemon juice, sugar, and toasted mustard seeds.

Warm up your menu with this spicy Indian-inspired curried tomato soup.

This south Indian dish of lentils and pigeon peas is quick, and easy on the stomach.

column2: East Indian Chicken with Tomato, Peas, and Cilantro
column3: East Indian curried chicken simmered in a spiced tomato sauce is a flavorful one-pan meal for any night of the week.

A prawn preparation made with coconut. Typical to the coastal areas of Karwar in Karnataka state, India.

column2: Pumpkin, Butter Bean, and Spinach Curry
column3: The whole family will love this mild and creamy vegetarian curry. It's easy to make too!

This Indian-inspired smoothie is creamy like a milkshake, sweet, smooth, and doesn't use sugar! It's great as a snack, and is the perfect compliment to all of my favorite Indian recipes.
A blend of spices flavor this adaptation of traditional South Indian dosas, a thin, crepe-like savory pancake.

These fried potato and vegetable balls are an Indian specialty served on special occasions.  Making it may sound tedious, but let me tell you it's worth the effort!  Get ready to impress your loved ones, with this recipe you just can't go wrong!

This fresh pumpkin soup seems straightforward since it's made with the standards-- fresh sugar pumpkin, onions, curry powder, garlic, light cream, and chicken stock--but there's also a tasty, surprise ingredient: peanut butter!
Cilantro and yogurt give these samosas the Indian flavor. This is an amazing recipe that will surprise you with how easy it is to make samosas like an Indian restaurant.
Carrots and featured in this creamy curried vegetable soup which is pureed and then thickened with instant potato flakes.
Fragrant and aromatic and delicious, as all Indian cooking seems to be. Spiced yogurt and piquant chutneys add dimension and flavor to this vertical offering of potatoes and garbanzo beans.
Battered and fried cauliflower is a delicious way to eat cauliflower, and a great snack! These are wonderful when dipped in yogurt.

Lightly spiced lentils in a tamarind and coconut sauce, tempered with Indian spices. Serve hot with rice. Try it with other vegetables too, such as potato, cauliflower or okra. The ingredients should be available at any Indian market or at specialty stores. The tamarind pulp may be substituted with reconstituted tamarind paste.

This semolina-based dish features onion, tomatoes, and chile peppers.
This tasty party dish can be made with ground lamb or beef.

Curry-coated chicken pieces are simmered in coconut milk with onion, garlic, spinach, and potato to make a quick and easy curry dish.
Homemade tandoori masala spice mix, a staple for Indian butter chicken, is easy to make at home with 11 ingredients.
Pan-frying a variety of spices with the lamb chops gives this curry dish a deep flavor.
This spicy potato dish is delicious served with rice.

column2: Grilled Lamb Chops with Curry, Apple and Raisin Sauce

Chicken drumsticks are simmered in a spicy onion sauce in this popular dish from Goa.
Yogurt and tandoori spice are stirred together and used as a marinade and basting sauce for grilled chicken. Makes four servings.

A tangy rice dish made with tamarind and curry leaves has a slightly sour flavor. It is very easy to make and it a favorite food in south India.

Alu Baigan is a West Indian curry made with potato and eggplant which is served with roti or rice and kadhri.  You can improvise with the ingredients if you are missing some; it tastes great even with just a few spices and hot pepper!  I like my eggplant to be completely mushy.
Whole eggplants are charred over an open flame to remove their skins, then mashed with yogurt and seasonings for this smoky side dish.
This delicious Indian-inspired omelet will certainly awaken your groggy tastebuds!
Halved Cornish game hens are baked with a multitude of vegetables and spices, making an elegant Indian entree.
This is an Indian-style yogurt lassi drink that's tangy, refreshing, subtly spiced with cumin and cilantro, but not sweet.

A mouthwatering appetizer of Indian origin, these tantalizing fried potato cutlets are spiced up with garam masala, coriander powder, and chopped fresh cilantro. They're an excellent change of pace as a side dish, too!
A traditional Bengali dish. It is easy to make and usually prepared using hilsa fish. However salmon or cod can be used instead.

A simple tangy yogurt and cucumber sauce makes a cooling accompaniment to your spicy main dishes. A hint of mint emphasizes the cooling action.

When the farmer's markets or your garden are pumping out greens like there's no tomorrow, try this flavorful North Indian way to cook them. Serve with hot cooked rice or naan for an Indian vegetarian treat with a different taste.
Garbanzo beans are simmered with onions and spices, then sprinkled with raw ginger and tomatoes in this Indian dish.

column2: Aloo Matar Paneer (Simmered Potatoes with Peas and Paneer)

This dish consists of sliced beets mixed with yogurt and seasoned with Indian spices.  It can be used as a side dish with Indian foods or eaten as is.

This simple, tasty sandwich combines the great textures of whipped cream cheese, chicken, and chutney.  Use smaller croissants to turn this into an appetizer, larger ones for a nice brunch! Enjoy!

This sweet confection from India and Pakistan combines chickpea flour, coconut, cardamom, and ground nuts.

Masala tea is also known as chai, and this is an easy, authentic version of the drink, made from scratch with milk and spices.
Spicy onions just like the ones served in Indian restaurants as a side dish! Delicious served with crispy pappadums as a starter for any Indian meal!

Just the thing for a cold wintry night. Here is a wonderfully easy recipe for traditional Indian tomato soup. It is ready in a jiffy, tastes wonderful, and acts as a lovely side-dish or appetizer. Serve it with a heavy curry/rice combo and some papadams and you are in heaven.

column2: Tangy Chicken with Pistachios and Fruit
column3: A sweet and tangy mixture of chicken with peaches, apricots and pistachios.  Indian curry powder and garam masala can be added for an even more exotic flavor. Serve with plain or basmati rice and a green vegetable for color.
This cabbage and tomato salad resonates with the spicy, nutty and pungent flavors of Indian cuisine.

This yummy rice, seasoned with fresh ginger and garlic, curry leaves, and cinnamon, is an excellent way to use up leftover cooked white rice. It tastes awesome hot or cold, especially hot on cold winter nights. Best of all, it takes all of ten minutes to make.
